main event: Several UFO sightings were reported in different locations, including Compton, California and Concord, California, during the 1950s.
interesting points: In Compton, a witness observed a rapid upward movement of a luminous object, approximately the size of a dime held at arm's length, for about 15 minutes.
In Concord, numerous small, snow-white, gleaming objects were observed floating and tumbling along on a clear, sunny day, eventually disintegrating upon touch.
The Lubbock Lights Report described formations of lights or glowing discs passing at high speeds and various altitudes, observed by Air Force Weather Observers.
One of the sightings reported the largest portion yet, about twelve glowing discs or lights of very dull white lights on the west horizon, leading to a presumption about atmospheric phenomena.
The report mentioned that all sightings, except one, were definite and not confused with natural phenomena, according to the observers at the weather station.
sighted object: various UFOs including luminous objects, snow-white gleaming objects, and glowing discs or lights
location: Compton, California; Concord, California; Lubbock, Texas
witnesses: various witnesses including a crew, a weather observer, and an Air Force Weather Observer
